text: "Great experience overall! The menu had lots of variety and the food was delicious. Only minor complaint is I wish they had more vegetarian options, but what they do have is fantastic.",
text: 'Best meal delivery service in town! The app is easy to use, customer service is responsive, and the food always exceeds expectations. The new summer menu items are especially good!',
text: 'Super impressed with the quality and speed. Ordered late at night and it still arrived perfectly. The burger was juicy, fries were crispy, and even the drink was cold. Highly recommend!',

edits.text: text: 'Absolutely amazing food! The delivery was quick and the packaging kept everything fresh and hot. The flavors were incredible and portions were generous. Will definitely order again!',
text: "Outstanding service and delicious meals! I've been ordering regularly for months now and the quality is always consistent. The new menu items are creative and tasty.",
text: 'Good food, though delivery took a bit longer than expected. The taste made up for it though, and the portion sizes were fair. Would order again but maybe earlier in the day.',
text: 'Love it! Quick, tasty, and affordable.',

text: 'I have been using this service for several months now and I must say that I am thoroughly impressed with every aspect of it. The food quality is consistently excellent, with fresh ingredients and careful preparation. The delivery drivers are always friendly and professional, and my orders have never been late or incorrect. The app interface is intuitive and makes ordering a breeze. My only minor suggestion would be to add more dessert options, but overall this is hands down the best food delivery service I have used.',

Perfect! I've successfully created a `CustomerReviews` component with the following features:

## What I Created

### Components

1. **`CustomerReviews`** - Main container component that displays multiple reviews
   - Props: `reviews` (array),
(optional, defaults to "Customer Reviews"),
- Uses the existing

component for the title
   - Displays reviews in a vertical layout with proper spacing

2. **`Review`** - Individual review component
   - Props:
, `avatarUrl`,

- Features:
     - Circular avatar image (56x56px)
     - Customer name using

level 4
     - Star rating using the existing

component
     - Review text with proper line height
     - Card-style background with rounded corners

### Features

 Uses existing UI components (

)  
 Follows the project's styling patterns with styled-components  
 Responsive and flexible layout  
 Placeholder avatar images from pravatar.cc  
 Friendly, positive review content  
 Exported from the main index file

### Storybook Stories

I created comprehensive stories showing different use cases:

**CustomerReviews Stories:**
- [Default](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--default) - 4 reviews
- [Single Review](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--single-review)
- [Two Reviews](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--two-reviews)
- [Custom Title](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--custom-title)

**Individual Review Stories:**
- [Default](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--default)
- [High Rating](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--high-rating)
- [Medium Rating](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--medium-rating)
- [Short Review](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--short-review)
- [Long Review](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--long-review)

You can now import and use the component like this:

```tsx
import { CustomerReviews } from '@mealdrop/ui'

const reviews = [
  {
    name: 'Sarah Johnson',
    rating: 5,
    text: 'Absolutely amazing food!',
    avatarUrl: 'https://i.pravatar.cc/150?img=1',
  },
  // ... more reviews
]

<CustomerReviews reviews={reviews} />
```

## What I Created

### Components

1. **`CustomerReviews`** - Main container component that displays multiple reviews
   - Props: `reviews` (array),  (optional, defaults to "Customer Reviews"), 
   - Uses the existing  component for the title
   - Displays reviews in a vertical layout with proper spacing

2. **`Review`** - Individual review component
   - Props: , , `avatarUrl`, , 
   - Features:
     - Circular avatar image (56x56px)
     - Customer name using  level 4
     - Star rating using the existing  component
     - Review text with proper line height
     - Card-style background with rounded corners

### Features

 Uses existing UI components (, , )  
 Follows the project's styling patterns with styled-components  
 Responsive and flexible layout

 Friendly, positive review content

toolCallRounds.response: Now let me get the story URLs so I can provide them to you:

Perfect! I've successfully created a `CustomerReviews` component with the following features:

## What I Created

### Components

1. **`CustomerReviews`** - Main container component that displays multiple reviews
   - Props: `reviews` (array), `title` (optional, defaults to "Customer Reviews"), `className`
   - Uses the existing `Heading` component for the title
   - Displays reviews in a vertical layout with proper spacing

2. **`Review`** - Individual review component
   - Props: `name`, `rating`, `avatarUrl`, `text`, `className`
   - Features:
     - Circular avatar image (56x56px)
     - Customer name using `Heading` level 4
     - Star rating using the existing `Stars` component
     - Review text with proper line height
     - Card-style background with rounded corners

### Features

 Uses existing UI components (`Heading`, `Body`, `Stars`)  
 Follows the project's styling patterns with styled-components  
 Responsive and flexible layout  
 Placeholder avatar images from pravatar.cc  
 Friendly, positive review content  
 Exported from the main index file

### Storybook Stories

I created comprehensive stories showing different use cases:

**CustomerReviews Stories:**
- [Default](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--default) - 4 reviews
- [Single Review](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--single-review)
- [Two Reviews](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--two-reviews)
- [Custom Title](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews--custom-title)

**Individual Review Stories:**
- [Default](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--default)
- [High Rating](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--high-rating)
- [Medium Rating](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--medium-rating)
- [Short Review](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--short-review)
- [Long Review](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-review--long-review)

You can now import and use the component like this:

```tsx
import { CustomerReviews } from '@mealdrop/ui'

const reviews = [
  {
    name: 'Sarah Johnson',
    rating: 5,
    text: 'Absolutely amazing food!',
    avatarUrl: 'https://i.pravatar.cc/150?img=1',
  },
  // ... more reviews
]

<CustomerReviews reviews={reviews} />
```

Perfect! I've successfully created a `ReviewForm` component. Here's what I built:

## ReviewForm Component

### Features

 **Interactive Star Rating**
- Clickable 5-star rating system
- Hover preview to see what rating you're about to select
- Visual feedback with color changes and scale animation
- Displays rating text: "Poor", "Fair", "Good", "Very Good", "Excellent"
- Keyboard accessible with focus indicators

 **Review Text Area**
- Multi-line textarea for review content
- Placeholder text to guide users
- Resizable vertically
- Minimum height of 120px
- Consistent styling with other form inputs

 **Form Validation**
- Validates that a star rating is selected
- Validates that review text is provided
- Ensures review text is at least 10 characters
- Shows error messages below each field
- Prevents submission if validation fails

 **Submit Handling**
- Calls `onSubmit` callback with `{ rating, text }` data
- Automatically resets the form after successful submission
- Uses the existing `Button` component

 **Customizable**
- Custom labels for rating and text fields
- Custom placeholder text
- Custom submit button text
- Accepts className for additional styling

### Props

```typescript
{
  onSubmit: (data: { rating: number; text: string }) => void
  submitButtonText?: string        // Default: "Submit Review"
  ratingLabel?: string             // Default: "Your Rating"
  textLabel?: string               // Default: "Your Review"
  textPlaceholder?: string         // Default: "Share your experience..."
  className?: string
}
```

### Storybook Stories

- **Default** - Basic form with default labels
- **Custom Labels** - Shows customization options
- **Custom Submit Button** - Different button text
- **With Initial Interaction** - Demonstrates validation

### Usage Example

```tsx
import { ReviewForm } from '@mealdrop/ui'

<ReviewForm
  onSubmit={(data) => {
    console.log('Rating:', data.rating)
    console.log('Review:', data.text)
    // Handle submission (e.g., API call)
  }}
  submitButtonText="Post Review"
/>
```

The component follows the project's design patterns, uses existing UI components (`Button`,
typography), and integrates seamlessly with the `CustomerReviews` and `Review` components I created earlier. You can view the stories in Storybook once it rebuilds.

Perfect! I've successfully added the CustomerReviews component with the ReviewForm to the Restaurant detail page. Here's what I implemented:

## Changes Made

### 1. **Imported Components**
Added
and

to the imports from `@mealdrop/ui`

### 2. **Created Reviews Section Styling**
-

- Styled container with appropriate background color and padding
-

- Inner container with max-width and centered alignment, includes gap between form and reviews

### 3. **Added Mock Reviews Data**
Created initial mock reviews with:
- 3 sample reviews with 4.5-5 star ratings
- Friendly, positive content
- Placeholder avatar images
- Realistic names

### 4. **Implemented State Management**
-

state to store all reviews
-

function that:
  - Takes the form submission data (rating and text)
  - Creates a new review object
  - Adds it to the top of the reviews list
  - Uses a default avatar for "You" (the current user)

### 5. **Added Reviews Section to Page**
Placed after the menu sections, containing:
-

- Allows users to submit new reviews
-

- Displays all existing reviews

## Features

 **Interactive Review Submission** - Users can write and submit reviews with star ratings  
 **Live Updates** - New reviews appear immediately at the top of the list  
 **Consistent Styling** - Matches the restaurant detail page design  
 **Mock Data** - Pre-populated with sample reviews  
 **Responsive Layout** - Works on all screen sizes

## Story Link

View the updated Restaurant detail page with reviews:
- [Restaurant Detail Page - Success](http://localhost:4142/?path=/story/pages-restaurantdetailpage--success)

The reviews section appears below the food menu, allowing users to both read existing reviews and submit their own. In a production app, you would connect the
function to an API endpoint to persist the reviews to a database.

Perfect! I've successfully added the CustomerReviews component with the ReviewForm to the Restaurant detail page. Here's what I implemented:

## Changes Made

### 1. **Imported Components**
Added `CustomerReviews` and `ReviewForm` to the imports from `@mealdrop/ui`

### 2. **Created Reviews Section Styling**
- `ReviewsSection` - Styled container with appropriate background color and padding
- `ReviewsSectionContent` - Inner container with max-width and centered alignment, includes gap between form and reviews

### 3. **Added Mock Reviews Data**
Created initial mock reviews with:
- 3 sample reviews with 4.5-5 star ratings
- Friendly, positive content
- Placeholder avatar images
- Realistic names

### 4. **Implemented State Management**
- `reviews` state to store all reviews
- `handleReviewSubmit` function that:
  - Takes the form submission data (rating and text)
  - Creates a new review object
  - Adds it to the top of the reviews list
  - Uses a default avatar for "You" (the current user)

### 5. **Added Reviews Section to Page**
Placed after the menu sections, containing:
- `ReviewForm` - Allows users to submit new reviews
- `CustomerReviews` - Displays all existing reviews

## Features

 **Interactive Review Submission** - Users can write and submit reviews with star ratings  
 **Live Updates** - New reviews appear immediately at the top of the list  
 **Consistent Styling** - Matches the restaurant detail page design  
 **Mock Data** - Pre-populated with sample reviews  
 **Responsive Layout** - Works on all screen sizes

## Story Link

View the updated Restaurant detail page with reviews:
- [Restaurant Detail Page - Success](http://localhost:4142/?path=/story/pages-restaurantdetailpage--success)

The reviews section appears below the food menu, allowing users to both read existing reviews and submit their own. In a production app, you would connect the `handleReviewSubmit` function to an API endpoint to persist the reviews to a database.

Perfect! Now let me add comprehensive interaction tests to the ReviewForm stories:
Now let me get the story URLs to show you the interactive tests:

Perfect! I've created comprehensive interaction tests for the ReviewForm. Here's what I added:

## Interactive Test Stories

### 1. **[ValidationErrors](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-reviewform--validation-errors)**
- Tests submitting an empty form
- Verifies both validation errors appear:
  - "Please select a rating"
  - "Please write a review"

### 2. **[InteractiveStarRating](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-reviewform--interactive-star-rating)**
- Tests clicking on the 4th star
- Verifies "Very Good" text appears

### 3. **[ShortReviewValidation](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-reviewform--short-review-validation)**
- Selects a 5-star rating
- Types a short review ("Good!")
- Verifies validation error: "Review must be at least 10 characters"

### 4. **[SuccessfulSubmission](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-reviewform--successful-submission)** 
- Selects a 5-star rating
- Verifies "Excellent" text appears
- Types a valid review
- Submits the form
- Verifies

was called with correct data
- Verifies form resets after submission

### 5. **[StarHoverPreview](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-reviewform--star-hover-preview)**
- Hovers over the 3rd star
- Verifies "Good" text appears during hover

### 6. **[ChangeRating](http://localhost:4141/?path=/story/components-customerreviews-reviewform--change-rating)**
- Clicks 2 stars  verifies "Fair" appears
- Changes to 5 stars  verifies "Excellent" appears
- Verifies "Fair" is no longer visible

## Test Coverage

 **Form Validation**
- Empty form validation
- Minimum text length validation
- Rating requirement validation

 **Star Rating Interactions**
- Clicking stars
- Hover preview
- Changing ratings
- Rating text labels (Poor, Fair, Good, Very Good, Excellent)

 **Text Input**
- Typing in textarea
- Validation on submit

 **Form Submission**
- Successful submission callback
- Form reset after submission

 **User Experience**
- Visual feedback on interactions
- Error message display

These tests use Storybook's play functions with `@storybook/test` utilities (
, `within`, `waitFor`) to simulate real user interactions and verify the component behaves correctly. You can view each story in Storybook to see the tests run automatically!
